intro: Canthium mabesae, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny calyx that encloses its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in dry, disturbed habitats. Canthium mabesae is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
